qas.question: What was the average net household income in Paris in 2011?
What was the average income in the 19th arrondissement?
What was the average in come in the 7th arrondissement?
What was the unemployment rate in the city of Paris?
What was the unemployment rate in the Siene-Saint-Denis department?

context: The average net household income (after social, pension and health insurance contributions) in Paris was <a0_0>€36,085<a0_0/> for 2011. It ranged from <a1_0>€22,095<a1_0/> in the 19th arrondissement to <a2_0>€82,449<a2_0/> in the 7th arrondissement. The median taxable income for 2011 was around €25,000 in Paris and €22,200 for Île-de-France. Generally speaking, incomes are higher in the Western part of the city and in the western suburbs than in the northern and eastern parts of the urban area.[citation needed] Unemployment was estimated at <a3_0>8.2<a3_0/> percent in the city of Paris and 8.8 percent in the Île-de-France region in the first trimester of 2015. It ranged from 7.6 percent in the wealthy Essonne department to <a4_0>13.1<a4_0/> percent in the Seine-Saint-Denis department, where many recent immigrants live.
